comment._content: The New York Times reported that Countess de Bertier and her infant son Arnaud were sailing aboard the Lusitania from London to New York, departing January 3, 1914. [1] Both the Countess and her husband were active supporters of the International Olympic Committee (IOC). Count Albert Bertier de Sauvigny was a member of the IOC representing France. [2] [3]

comment._content: then this is A Deck (Boat Deck) starboard side, at the base of the stairs leading up to the Marconi (wireless) room. The door just behind her leads to the main staircase and elevator area between funnels 2 and 3. The window on our left is the farthest front on the Saloon Lounge and Music Room. You can see the deck plan here www.rmslusitania.info/pages/deck_plans/a-deck.html I also located it on my Lusitania model, you can get a better idea of where it is here [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29079609@N02/4316803135/]
